reviewText:
It's strange... I played this game for countless hours back in it's prime, back when I was in high school. I made some friends, I made some enemies, I saw so much world drama, names like Wizzled came second nature to my knowledge. (This guy apparently bought thousands of dollars of stuff from the cash shop, then taunted GM's saying they could never ban such a huge supporter of the game. Long story short, he eventually got banned iirc. Never learned if he managed to get back on.)

I will say right now, I absolutely love Perfect World. It's probably the nostalgia talking, but I've never spent more time in a world than I did with this one. It's music, it's locales, just casually flying around and chatting with people... I've never felt the same way about an MMO as I have this one. (I currently play FF XIV, and as much as I love it, I can't seem to bring myself to converse with others on the level I did back on PW.) I've never clicked install so fast in my life... however... this is not the game I fell in love with...

Right off the bat, the character creation has been absolutely butchered. All of the old hair-styles have been removed from the character creation screen. Apparently you can still get them with ini file editing... but what the hell is the point in that?! I can't make a character without actually seeing how I'm editing them...
Not to mention, the slides have been absolutely destroyed. Even back in the day, you could make really strange looking characters, from twig apendages, to boobs twice the size of your head, but they were never in the incredibly rediculous range... now... oh my god now... these sliders... you can make the stuff of nightmares... Shoot, the default settings are horrific on their own.

The original starting zones have been completeley done away with, and replaced by a One for all beginer zone, that I never actually managed to get past due to a dungeon-esque instance near the end that I couldn't find a party for. (This game is old-school, no party finder. Gotta do it the old fashioned way.) Not to mention, the new starting zone just feels... wrong. This may be because I've made SO many alts and played through the original 3 starting zones hundreds of times, but this new one is just... ugh... I miss walking into my race's home village at lv 2-3, and just conversing with the large number of players that were always just hanging around those zones for no real reason.

I've never truly understood how Vanilla WoW players felt until now. Going back to a game I loved so dearly over four years later, and seeing it â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥ized so badly... (I'm pretty sure the game is under new ownership, and that probably has a huge part to do with my feeling really uncomfortable with the game as it stands now.) It almost physically hurts.

I want to recommend this game so badly, but it is no longer the game I loved, and it's too aged to be of much interest to most newcomers these days. If it were to get some huge quality of life changes, such as a party finder, level synch, and a return to the old character creation system, I would recommend this game without a second thought.

In the meantime, I DO at least recommend looking up the OST for this game. I found myself booting up PW so many times just to listen to the background music while I did my homework in high school. It is so relaxing, and atmospheric... Going back to listen to it now gives me chills, and makes me yearn for a time where this game was great.

I'm going to try to give it some more time, maybe the changes will grow on me. But as a long time old school player of this game, my first impression is that the game is worse off than it was.

reviewText:
I was a wallet warrior when it came to this game some years ago, lured in by the promise of balanced pvp in the end game (if you spent a lot of money for max gear). Well after spending literal thousands of dollars I was still getting one-shot by people who spent more money, or had p-mod friends.
I kept coming back the the game, for some reason, until one day they compiled the servers(due to too few people playing), and they merged my server with an EU server. My ping shot up from 200ms (on an American server, yes their servers are real bad) to 500ms constant. When I asked support if they could move me to an American server they declined. That's just something we can't do" they said.

Well it took having a company that I contributed thousands of dollars to spitting in my face for me to finally realize how garbage the game is. The classes are unbalanced. It takes $2500+ to get viable end game gear. You only ever do 3 dungeons more than once. More than half of the content in the game is long since dead (some items and npcs literally have no use anymore). There's no way to get money outside of buying it. The graphics are straight outa 07
date: and optimization is bad. I have a lot I could say about this game
recommended: but the biggest thing is  STAY AWAY FROM IT\n\nTL;DR: Garbage game. Garbage graphics. Garbage PvP Balancing. Garbage PvE. Unmeaninful (Garbage) quests. Pay to win  incarnate . I wouldn't recomend this game to my worst enemy
hoursPlayed: the most fun you can have while playing it is autopathing around the massive empty map at world height for hours.\n\nOnly plus is the soundtrack. It's pretty tight."

reviewText:
This is an example of what can happen with a good game touched by the greedy hands of an poor minded group who cannot maintain a ballanced experience for the free players and the people who have well payed jobs and can afford supporting the game industry.
Since this is a review ill try to keep it short.This is an old fashion mmmorg(ya know select attack enemy or use tab to select then press skills in sequence,no dodge or block only evasion,no instance matching y must go to the dungeon entrance or teleport to the nearest entrance etc)so dont expect outstand sparkles comming out of ya but when ya fight.
Pros:
-beautifull graphics for a 1st generation mmo
-liberty of movement like everywhere
-big worldmap with diverse landscapes,creatures and atmosphere
-alot of social interractions(2 people of opposite gender can ride the same mount,alot of other love interractions:D)
-good diversed gears
-very good early/middle game gameplay(although the quests are soo boring )
-a very good roleplaying mmo(tanks must tank healers keep squad up,dps do tons of dmg etc)
-territorials wars can host about 100 players on each side(if i remember well and yea massive lag:D)
-and last but not least diverse mounts(ground or air)and diverse way of boosting up ya character stats
-beautiful music,i still miss the radio they had:D
Cons(in order):
-same map bugs i discovered in 2008-2010;
-inability to adapt the monster's and dungeons  to the assasin class made everything easy and soloable(its the only buff tat doesnt dissapair in a dungeon when debuffed and stealth issues)
-the introduction of an GOD gear aka R9gear(The endgame gear of ALL gears) made every other endgame gear useless due to their very low stats and extra skills compare to the mother of all gears:/
-to be able to get R9 you need reputation which(god knows why) without reaching a fabulous 300k worth you cannot have access to it,in game that reputation farm would lead you at least a decade of farming it,so that is why you can buy reputation from the store with real muney^^ or farm 3mil coins to get 1 gold=about1200 rep:D
-another condition to get R9 is to get war medals(from tw IF you win...if u lose u get few or non)buut the amount you need to get enough medals from tws is......rather too unballanced....and since tw takes place once/twice per week..yea..
-R9 destroyed the economy,made ingame money riiiiiise and never stopped,p2w player now control the market and you as new player puke when you see those numbers
-R9 can 1hit all other gears in terms of stats/buffs/defense and attack levels
-in short R9 destroyed the endgame and ultimatly discouraged the free player base to look up for other mmmos to play..
-R9 rulles pwi and the game is going into the R9 burning pits veery slowly...but certaint...

As a big fan of this game....the innability of the devs to listen to its comunity,to promote the R9 gear as if its our goal in life,to continue focusing of getting more money and leave the game behind made me quit and try other new mmos far better in all ways.From my point of view,if they dont make R9 accesible or delete it,reballencing the endgame gears so that WE all fight with equal chances of winning,the game will slowly die.....

reviewText:
There are some pros and cons to this game, and unfortunately, the cons outweigh the pros in a massive way.
My gametime on Steam does not reflect the time sunk into this game prior.

Pros:
- Atmospheric
- Great soundtrack
- Entertaining lower level gaming (if you enjoy questing)

Cons:
- Grind to win, and no, not just a little.
- Pay to win
- Expensive cash shop
- No real customization of your character unless you use the expensive cash shop
- Shifts from PvE to PvP rather sharply, and PvP is extremely unbalanced
- Bad sound effect quality
- Terrible use of English. For how much money they ask players to spend they could hire some proper translators/writers.
- Terrible time sink. You're literally forced to spend many hours to progress anywhere. It's possible to avoid some of this, by spending, you guessed it, actual cash.

It's a smart setup by the game makers but players will inevitably end up spending a lot of time and money (or even more time) into this game only to find out that past the starter levels which are just an introduction to the game mechanics, it becomes an unbalanced PvP-heavy game with lots of people gouging the in-game market to get ahead of others by necessity. It's all the bad aspects of an unbalanced MMO with a pretty, Eastern presentation layer on top.

So, even if I'd want to give this good marks, I simply cannot. Their recent updates have only made it worse despite some of the redesigns they've done to improve characters. Don't waste your time on this, there are much, much better MMOs out there.

reviewText:
I played this game for years before it was on Steam, quit last year. Only added it on Steam to leave a review.

Pros:
Nice character design

Cons:

PvP was pretty much destroyed by PWE in the server merge.

Most PvP is cash shop to win. As in thousands of dollars. Didn't always used to be that way but it is now. A two year old could win if their parent cashshopped enough.

GMs play favorites, blantant violations of the ToS go unpunished.

The politics on servers are frustrating and make it impossible to do much of the game activitiy if you irritate a small group of people.

PvE is boring after a few weeks.

Graphics are outdated.

Patches rarely fix any actual issues, some bugs can be ignored for years.


Seriously, don't play this game. Rolling around in toxic waste would be better for you. At least then you might gain mutant powers; this game will only give you a massive headache.

reviewText: More than 6 years ago, this game was an excellent contribution to the Free-to-play MMORPG market.  The world is vast and beautiful, though my first return in several years indicates it has not aged well.  The P2W elements have become very strong since my hayday, and the transaction cost for gold to cash currency has become so great that the in-game auction system cannot even support the high cost people require.  This leaves people at the mercy of direct player-to-player trades, which are very poorly implemented (if the other player disconnects mid trade, you are stuck with their listed items, how is this an issue in 2016?) and extremely risky.\n\nThis game had its prime, the only reason it has finally come to steam is to try and squeak out some more profits for the developer.  The combat is dated, clunky and slow.  As a Guild Wars 2 player, I can never return to such poor UI and control options.  Every other modern MMO has upgraded as well, so there is no reason to test such an old F2P game, that does not do anything to ingratiate free players.  Try one of the dozens of other free MMOs available.

reviewText: I have played this game on and off for 8 years. It is the largest Pay to Win game ever created. You must spend thousands of dollars just to compete on this game and they are not shy about it. For example you have a character that is in his end game gear with decent refines all your skills are maxed and stats are good. If you fight a total cash shop player (R-9 or R-999 which costs thousands in real world money) you may do 200- 300 damage per hit on the R-9 Geared toon BUT when they hit you it is for 150- 200 thousand. That shows you how off balance the game is. Even the PVE is this way. This game does not even try to disguise its greed in any way. Please avoid this game. It has nothing to do with skill or effort and everything to do with cash especially when you reach 100 plus.

reviewText:
As a new player to Perfect World International, I decided to give it a shot. I do like that you can fly and swim, and can also engage in combat while doing so, and how there is effort put into pieces of equipment that actually are represented on your character when equipped. While the game definitely is massive and has tons of content, the graphics and combat system are dated and can't be compared to modern MMO's. Questing is as generic as can be, go here, kill that, pick that up, explore this, come back to the NPC for your reward. Low level matchmaking especially in the tutorial zone (which in my case was needed for the job advancement and end of tutorial quest) was nonexistent and I was unable to successfully form a party for the dungeon which I wound up tackling by myself in the end. The biggest turn off for me however is the aformentioned Pay To Win elements mentioned in other reviews, as refining your equipment to have better stats as a paying player is much safer, easier and more convenient than if you were a completely free to play player, provided you have the money to shell out. Overall, I can't recommend this game as there are much better and fairer Free to Play MMO's out there.

I've also written a more detailed review which you can view by visiting the website below:
http://freetoplayreview.com/perfect-world-international-review

reviewText:
I played this game years ago. I admit that I spent quite a bit of time in PWI, as I made many friends there and every now and again I still listen to the PWI music. However, I can't recommend the game to anyone else. In fact, I advise for anyone considering this game to stay the heck away from it. Here is why:

1) This is a Pay2Win game. It's as simple as that.
2) The PvE is garbage. The content is crap, same boring, pointless, often mis-spelled quest dialogue, followed up by more boring, unoriginal quest dialogue.
3) The PvP used to be the reason to play PWI, but the thing is, unless you pay real money to gear yourself, you will never be able to compete with the others on the PvP field. It's not a skill thing, it's not an rng thing, it is very simply a money thing. If you don't pay, you don't get end game gear. Pay money, get viable end game gear.
4) Game currency doesn't drop, â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥ exp gains, â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥ gear unless you pay real money for gear.

I am a bit nostalgic when it comes to this game, as I remember sinking countless hours (and many, many dollars) into it back in the day, but the new version of PWI isn't even worth the download, imo. The game is old, a lot of the features that were in it before were removed (character creation is looking really lacklustre... didn't there used to be more hairstyles??). I don't know what happened to the starting villages, and the entire game just feels extremely dated. I remember this game fondly through rose-colored glasses, but PWI as it is now is just a waste of time and money.

TL;DR: Game is dated, old, boring, garbage. PvE is absolute crap. PvP is Pay2Win. Gear in the game is Pay2Win.  PWI is just a garbage Pay2Win game. It's crap and it's not worth wasting your time on.

reviewText:
Before this game came to Steam, I'm sure I had spent a couple thousand hours playing from 2011-2013. I loved it!  Going back to it now, not so much. After logging on after not actively playing for a few years, so many things have changed about this game and I don't think these changes are for the better. It's a shame because a few years ago I would have recommended this game to anybody.

Even back in 2011 and 2012 the game was very pay to win, but definitely not as bad as it seems to be now. If you wanted the best gear at the time and you didn't want to grind countless hours for it, it was going to cost you about $1500 if I remember correctly. Yes, real money. Many people at the time would actually spend this crazy amount of money just so they could be the best and one-shot everyone in PVP. I can't imagine the cost of the gear nowadays. It's unfortunate that the game is ruined by this factor. I think it could have so much more potential if players didn't feel like they have to pour thousands of dollars into the game just to get a shiny set of powerful gear.

The one thing that I will always love about this game is the music in it. It's so beautiful and I recommend checking it out even though I don't recommend playing the game!

Overall I wouldn't recommend this game to anyone unless they feel like spending a significant amount of real money closer to the endgame stage. It just doesn't seem like it would be fun anymore.

reviewText:
I played and paid for several years back when I lived in the states but after I moved to China, my account got blocked for being out of market.  I was hoping they had changed their policy so US-created accounts could play regardless of physical location, but sadly that hasn't changed.

The same game is available from alternate sources, which also cater to English speakers, and they don't place restrictions on location, so if you like this game but are not in a supported market, you can begin your adventure with a more tolerant company.

Overall, the game is fine.  I like the PVE elements the most, so I don't worry too much about the cash shop.  The thing I don't like about this version of the game is the company.  Other licensed versions of PW are global-friendly.  This one is not.

reviewText:
Had I be writing this back in 2009 when I started playing PWI, I'd be going on and on about it, but frankly, with every expansion they only make it worse and worse to the point they've gone down the modern WoW route and only add new stuff to temporarily bring back players.

Simply put, the game, as is now, is not worth anyone's time. I'd recommend private servers, especially since I play on one now, but those are often modeled on the premise that you already played PWI and know some of its aspects, like instances or where to get a certain item, which can be an issue if you've never played PWI, but if that doesn't bother you, then by all means come right ahead.

It may show only 1.4 hours on my record, but I assure you I unfortunately have thousands upon thousands of hours put into this game ever since I started playing it when I was so much younger (and when it wasn't on Steam - wasn't on Arc even), and it pains me that a game that gave me so much joy and so many memories has been reduced to this.

reviewText:
Product received for free

Let me be honest here. Perfect World is probably one of the greatest F2P games I had ever played back in the day. When it came out on Open Beta for the Americans and everyone else around the world outside of China, it was hyped. It was a REALLY fun game, the story was lacking a bit, and there was some mistranslations here and there, but it was a refreshing feel. The races were quite unique (especially the Untamed. I LOVE the Untamed. Venomancers are my favourite now because of this game.), the areas are BEAUTIFUL at max graphics for a free to play game, the world is MASSIVE, and the monsters and NPCS actually look pretty good.

Now, honestly, this game could have more potential. For instance, the PVP and PVE is... weird. Okay, so you CAN'T avoid magic or arrow damage, and they act like homing missiles when you fire your bow/crossbow/slingshot/magical spell (And i think its really weird how there's class exclusive weapons for bows and arrows when ANYONE can use those, but not crossbows or Slingshots... like wtf?). There is also lack in variation of uniques for the original 3 classes. Especially for mages... EVERYONE WEARS A FREAKING STAFF OR SOMETHING LIKE THAT! When I saw some things on Perfect World Item Database, there was weapons like Whips, Staffs, and even Shields. Of course, they were probably canceled weapons. I even saw a blacksmith mention tridents and some other weapons, those were canceled too. To be honest, it would be fitting if the Venomancers had whips because their race description says they're seductive beings too, so it would make sense. Because if they have aspects of a succubus, it would fit.

The PVE I felt is lacking... to be honest, the way of defeating a boss really isn't that interesting. There needs to be more strategey and more safespots for bosses. The fact that if you go too far away from ranging or maging it, they REHEAL. WHY?!?!?! I think every mob needs a magic or ranged attack or not heal and have a stupid AI for the beginner levels, but at harder levels, they gain more of a magical/ranged attack, or even use all three. It's broken, and I think it needs fixing.

Overall, this game is quite average, but I felt it really turned around after 2010. The community is still alive, but the game is really easy now... and pretty quite simple. I just hope someone out there, Perfect World II is being made, and all of these changes can be implemented. Maybe even get a story, since this entire game has VERY LITTLE basings of a Main story. Spiritual Cultivation is confusing at times when it talks about the story. To be honest, if it was a main story from level 1-105, it woudl be nice. Maybe make Fengsha the final boss of the main storyline? Then maybe for level 105s, a new story to go up to level 150? Because i feel that is what the game really needs. So we can keep engaged, and such. Would be also great to have an ironman mode.

All in all, this game is a 5/10 for me. I mean, I'd play it, but wouldn't. That's why I really don't reccommend this game... It's up to you. I mean, I still play it, but only sometimes.

reviewText:
I'll start out with the not user friendly issue:
You have to use your EMAIL as your USERNAME because they changed it 3-4 years ago for the new system they have set up via ARC. Obviously, they should fix that for those who didn't want to download their launcher and is downloading it from Steam. Another is, if PWI offer you something, usually redeeming the item is through ARC's site or their launcher and not here on Steam. So if you want their free offers, you'll have to keep that in mind.

My years of this game is a full running 8 years (almost 9), I quit or rotated around different MMOs that offer better aspects. Don't get me wrong though, PWI itself has its own kinks that makes people keep coming back. The pretty art style, the fashion (if you love to dress up that is), the customization (you can find more on their ARC forums how to make it better customized for your character). The mounts are beautiful as well, the new features they try adding makes it extremely OP in PVE and PVP.

The downside of this game is, if you are the type who want to be end game, to be THE BEST, to be able to do whatever without a squad half the time, it is PAY TO WIN. Mind you, you can farm it all up within time if you have a set mind for it. But the aspect of those who do pay to win is not learning how to really control one's class properly and you may end up disliked for those who have been around longer like myself. Hell, if you are new I'll even tell you this - no one really helps one another anymore unless you find that special someone who had offer you in All Chat.

People who are giving thumb downs for a FREE-TO-PLAY is because they don't look into it completely. I'll be honest, I'm giving it a thumbs down for those who are reading my review, because you can find something much better to play and find more propose in gaining something rather spending money into it just to be THE BEST.

Its my personal thoughts honestly. You can play, try it out, give it your own personal thoughts before anything else.

reviewText:
Product received for free

I have played this game many years (2009), first through just pwi, then through arc, and just recently tried it through steam. Anyone looking for fun fantasy world to fully solo it like me, go elsewhere or play just to level 20 :)

Tried using graphics button and settings here on steam before loading game after a problem of not everything shown on screen first time, it refused to confirm my settings. I do not have a wide screen monitor and the game via steam will not allow me to play unless it is set on wide screen apparently.

Via Arc this is a playable game, via steam it is not. It doesn't allow any customizing via steam for me.

Overall the game itself, is now play to win, has much fewer people playing at all these days (they have merged most of the servers for the few left playing), and I have ALWAYS ALWAYS ALWAYS HATED that dungeons and cultivation REQUIRES TEAM PLAY...so no you will never solo this game until you get to level 100s and have had to team play every single 10 levels twice or more since level 20.

Yeah you have to find a team yourself...goodluck when there is barely anyone online at all, and half are lower level than you and cant help and the other half will run you through a dungeon at warp speed and clerics and duskblades (which run slower than all other characters) get left behind just trying to folllow and no time to pick up drops (some even steal your drops--and you gotta pay for having barely any backpack space so usually you are full and cant even pick up much in any dungeons) once full you gotta dump stuff or wait till you get back to town for your own safe or to sell to a merchant.

Did I mention having a full backpack and full safe? Yeah everyone does, some even have extra characters just to hold things, since you gotta either craft everything or buy it from another player who crafted it (from potions to armor to weapons to accessories)...and yeah you gotta craft it since the drops are crapola.

You can farm for overall 10 levels worth of experience just trying to up your craft skills so you are then allowed to craft higher level gears. which yes another 10 levels worth of experience for the materials to craft it (by then you are 20 levels up and need to up your craft skills again for newer gears....they began giving new players great gears free that carry them up into about level 40 without the player needing to craft like it used to be, then you get stranded in level 40 needing to go back for low level materials from evironment and monsters in order to up your craft skills right at the moment it is hardest to up craft skills to get to the next level in crafting (so yeah newbies at level 40-50 you will need to craft your own grears and it may take you a few months (to even a year depending how much you play and wanna mindlessly farm....fewer free players farming for materials and selling cheaply now, so they cost a lot and most of the time no one is selling them at all, so yea pay to win players you too will now have to farm since no free players means no one is farming materials....to gather enough materials to up your craft skills to do it, even though you can get to that point in just 1-3 days depending how much you play on those days.

Confusing right? Yep. Mindlessly farm for months on end hoping to up your craft skills since no one is selling materials or lower than 100 gears...no matter how much in game gold or boutique gold you got. No one online at all outside of the busiest town in the whole world at some points in the day and night (most of those offline selling stuff in shops). (I played east coast usa server--used to be 3 servers, now just 1 and still barely anyone online playing, especially at night). Sure people will say nah there are people, level 100+ people, barely anyone under level 80, so not a chance in tartarus of finding a dungeon team your same level to battle any dungeons below level 90. And most 90+ level players are tired of running noobs through same old lower dungeons, since they got all the reputation they need and get barely any other incentive for doing it.

If you wanna still try playing this game (which is fun up to level 20 when you gotta do your first team dungeon), play it via Arc not steam for better customization of graphics. Enjoy the first 20 levels, then go to a different game or create a new character, since after that team dungeon the game just goes downhill requiring too much farming and team play to enjoy after that. Did I mention I HATE TEAM PLAY!!! I prefer SOLO PLAY AT ALL TIMES! Just because I like fantasy adventure type free world game play doesnt mean I wanna play with other players, its okay if it is entirely optional, in this game it is absolutely required if you want to go up in levels and strength.

So anyone looking for fun fantasy world to fully solo it, go elsewhere or play just to level 20 :)

reviewText:
Yes, there are a lot of things wrong with this game, but there is no end to things to do, level, try, build, aggro, yell at, scream at, people to meet, things to buy(boutique is addictive, yes, verry addictive), puzzle over, and ask questions about.

It has changed a lot since it was introduced, and yes, I still recommend it to people.  There is a reason that even though a lot of people say bad things, they are still playing.  The world chat is always full of talk, the guilds are always competing for land, the housing system was just introduced, and no I don't have a house yet.  I started playing when it was in Malaysia and switched over to PWI after they opened to the US.

Somethings I cry about losing, but over all, I really missed it for that year or so that I couldn't play.   The music still haunted me.  The landscape was in my dreams at night.  I was one of the people who used to put the server page up to listen to the music while I cleaned house years ago.  The music for that page is gone, but some of the original music can still be found on the original map.

The only thing I can say is be careful not to spend everything you have on this game.  It will suck you dry if not careful, but it is still possible to play without too much cash.  Just don't try to get top spot in P2W fashion unless you are willing to sink thousands into it.  Just find a good guild where people are willing to help you get through your cultis and you should be fine.

reviewText:
Despite the large number of Negative Reviews I like to give an honest review of this game.

First thing to note this game been out for 8 years if not more.  So the graphics might be dated to current technologies.  They have done a good job enhancing the support for higher resolutions.  Performance of the game varies depending on the settings you choose vs what your computer can handle.  I own a mid to low end pc in terms of specs.  I manage to get anywhere from 30 to 50 frames after tweaking the settings to my likings.

There are many features added over the years that enhanced the experience for players.  Most notably is the removal of the trainers in favor of leveling your skills on the fly.  You still pay for the skills, just no more needless trips back to a trainer to improve your skills.  They improved the Autopathing to avoid obsecles when on foot.  Making it easier to find quest objectives.   The numerous rewards available to players new and old helps keep people interested in playing new characters.  Since everyone gains access to the basic level Aerogear and Mount no one needs to spend real cash to experience the game.

Speaking of spending real cash.  The boutique houses many cosmetic and enhancing items that improve the gaming experience quality.  Ranging from Fashion to better Aerogear and Mounts.  Despite the many reviews that say this game is Pay to Win, I like to set the facts straight.  PWI uses the boutique in such a way to make the game easier not to win.  All content is available to you in game without purchases necessary.  Sure the use of the Boutique will accelerate the game for you, but it wont improve your skill or give you an unfair advantage.

Little more details on what I mean by Not being Pay to Win.  The complaints many have is the fact that Rank 9 Reputation Gear you get in the game require the purchase of boutique items.  This was true years ago, but most of the requirements can be met through alternative means.  So if you are willing to work for it you can easily avoid the need to purchase anything using real cash.

Why you don't need to use real cash, you can trade for the gold that is used in the Boutique without purchasing real cash currency Zen.  Completely by passing the need to pay cash.  Hence why I said PWI is not Pay to win but Pay to accelerate your progress.

I hope this review was helpful and unbias information for players who are interested in the game but might be swayed not to play because of the poorly judged reviews.

PS.  I like to mention that all content that is in this Game are available with zero purchases.  So you can play without a pay wall.  PvP mostly dominated by establish players.  If you are incline to be PvP orient expect to work hard to reach the desired level of competition.  Otherwise PvP is a permission base system, Unless you choose to tag yourself as hostile target.

reviewText:
PWI is not only about getting end-game gear and competitive PvP. Indeed, it's hard and expensive to get the end-game gear + maximum refinements, but PWI has a lot more other things to offer.

The road to level 100. Going through every level, enjoying every quest and exploring the areas and listening to the soundtrack. Oh yeah, PWI has a lot of beautiful areas where you can find yourself standing and staring at the landscape. Or just listening to the beautiful music.

Every new Dungeon that comes each 10 levels and wondering what new things can I discover here. Joining your first squad and do a dungeon, defeating your first boss.

Joining your first Guild/Faction. Making friends.

Be scared of some huge bosses which later they'll become solo-able.

Lots and lots of fashion.

Farming your own gear and feel like you worked hard for it.
These are just a few things that come into my mind. If you don't play for being the best geared player on the game (being the best in PvP), then this is a great MMORPG you should play.

reviewText:
Pros:
Diversified Class.
A lot of quests and pve stuffs.
Fast and easy leveling
Fast and easy to get gears until lvl 100.
A lot of instance (dungeons)
PvP is interesting if you are good at it.
Good visual in full graphic.
Cross Server PvP events
Lots of level guilds (at least on Dawnglory server)

Cons:
Old game engine that makes fps be low at high populated place even with high end PC.
A lot of Dailys that are needed to do for a few months (2-3 months) to pvp because they give a pvp stat.
At least 4 months to catch up for pvp (if you learn fast and get help) (also Pro or Con depending if 4 month is long or not for you).

This game is now made for people that learn fast and for people that are good in mmorpgs. Someone that has no experience at all in any mmorpgs will enjoy this game but will take very long to catch up. When i made my stormbringer (which was one of the new class last year), it took me 1 month to get it to lvl 100 with just quests and dailys (didnâ€™t need to play 24/7 for that). Then it took arround 2 other months to make it able to pvp and it worth it because I enjoyed pvp with it even if I didnâ€™t bother to gear it properly.

As for r9rr(endgame gears), most people now are able to get r9 with farming or merchanting when you learn what to do. Myself I managed to gear up 3 character with full r9rr +10 with 12 weapons and decent cards and gems (which is the average gear now in pvp). But in my opinion, this game is worth playing. All the new people i met in game were liking the game, gearing up isnt that hard if you find how to do and is good at it. I know many people that made their char about 1 year ago and geared them like mine or even better in 1 year or less because they knew what they had to do. So if you learn fast and is good in mmorpgs you should take arroung 6-7 months to be able to pvp with the average people, 6-7 months to catch up in a 8 years old game isnâ€™t that bad in my opinion and it totally worth it! I play since 2009 and I still enjoy the game even if it has no more surprises for me now since I know it almost perfectly. I enjoy making new characters to level them up and even working on them to be able to pvp on it.

Also, myself and many other people that I know often help low level players. There's also many guilds for low levels that help each other and work together to get their stuffs. If you want, I play on Dawnglory server (Europe server) and you can pm me ingame (Seeker_King) for information or help.

See you in game!

reviewText:
The majority of the negative reviews are made by people that quit this game years ago or gave up because they had to work to keep up with the others. The game has changed a lot, and much more content has been added. PWI is NOT pay-to-win. That's a false assumption made by those that wish to be 'THE' best with no competition at all and failed to achieve that. Sadly there's many of those around.

Perfect World International is great once you learn the mechanics, although this takes time and patience. It's also a great way to socialize with the large playerbase. Reaching 'endgame' takes a lot of effort though, while a large part of the playerbase have years of experience and work put into their characters.

Having played this game for more than eight years, i recommend anyone curious to try out the game to avoid setting impossible goals for yourself. Take it easy, take your time to learn how to play the game. PWI might be a little difficult to learn in the beginning, but the fun you can have with your friends in the large open world and many caves are near limitless. Just commit yourself to it and don't give up when it becomes challenging.

reviewText:
Okay so, after returning from a near 7 year hiatus from the game i'm quite happy with this game's progress.

Music is still just as cheerful and relaxing as i remember, gameplay is still just as easy to work with... But that's where things kinda end for me.


Here's what's changed in the last 7 hour non-stop game run i just did after jumping on for the first time since 2006! :D

*POSITIVE POINTS*

1: I managed to remember my original credentials (which is AWESOME!) and my barbarian is still very much useable, which i'm very greatful for as i had maxed out his bank and inventory slots, and had gotten a small account shared bank for it. On top of that he's my primary weapon/armor crafter. However the control scheme had been altered *severely* and i had to make a new character to get the hang of the new scheme that the game now runs.

2: I've found out something that many of you veterans may over look when you get back into game. There's an Earning Time" counter that keeps track of enemies you kill in a region (the timer is based on combat log
date: so if you're in an engagement it counts those seconds
recommended: not the overall time of being in the area.). While this timer is active you earn EXP
hoursPlayed: spirit and drops! Which means a level 50 can potentially earn concentrated glue from the level 35 monsters without the major drop in chance-rate we used to encounter where it became almost impossible to procure materials. This is amazing! I'm very glad for this change. However testing with a new-found friend from the olden-days as well
voteText: whom has a level 90: The counter still goes even if you do not acquire drops from the kill. This more than likely means one-shot regions are still not a viable source of material acquisition for level 90's
helpfulPercent: so make sure you level your crafting/blacksmith/armor and such
votesTotal: at least until level 4 so you're using things that are available from level 40+ monsters This *should in theory* make it so you can continue leveling even maxxed out on your character's overall level if this testing proved anything...\n\n3: gameplay overall runs smoothely
votesFunny: the game hasn't gotten much bigger than it was 6 years ago when i stopped playing from boredom
commentsCount:
but has had many new features added to it and quite a few new quests to keep players going.

*NEGATIVE POINTS*

1: The tutorial zone is tedius as all hell
column16: I'm sorry... the graphics are nice for the region sure but the monsters (especially the Devil Towers in the SilverFox's sunlight Cave/final dungeon in the tutorial) are lacking depth in many reguards. Attacks have little effort put into their detail/effects
column17: monster movement is glitchy and they walk through walls like they always did. I would think with being around since early 2006 as Alpha
column18: going into Beta in 2007 until 2009 and then in open gameplay since 2009
column19: you'd have at least *some* grasp at A.I pathfinding and model clipping. But nothing has changed in that reguard.\n\n2: Auto-Pathfinding is still just as clunky as ever
column20: if not worse. Running into trees

reviewText:
Alright, lemme tell you a story...

Back in it's initial release/fish update.  The game was relatively Free 2 Play, where you have to farm/grind, and party your way to the top, where it was pretty costly to get the high tier skill books, but all in all, a pretty nice game.

Then came the initial R9 update, at first it wasn't that bad, having it being reviewed, and was implemented in the game without a cash shop following for quite some time.

But when it did come out in the cash shop, samething that was equally hard to get to achieve such weapons also came into play:  Reputation Badges...

This quickly became Work hard to get what you want" to "Pay a metric butt ton and you get what you want"

A few months after that I started my mostly 3 year hiatus

hoursPlayed: and including that 3 year hiatus.\n\nAfter 3 years I came back

reviewText:
The game is pretty fun, i played it a lot back when it wasn't on Steam. It's not p2w, since you can get anything with in-game money, but it costs quite a lot and requires a lot of time. The game is not optimized as much as it could be, but well, it runs. It has a solid playerbase, and servers in each region.

The world is huge, filled with dungeons, bosses and lots of cool stuff.
You can choose between 6 races, each race having 2 classes, adding to a total of 12 classes.


Despite the fact that people say it's p2w, i think you should still try it out since you can get anything w/o paying, and also you could have a lot of fun. ~plus, the game is free, you don't have anything to lose. Hopefully you found this review helpful. Have a great day people, thanks for reading.
